Articles.Content:
In 1970 Japan became the fourth country to launch an artificial satellite into orbit on their own. It was called Ohsumi

![lk60FVJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/lk60FVJ.jpg)

Here is my recreation

![pff2nia.png](http://i.imgur.com/pff2nia.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T07:52:35Z" title="08/09/2015 07:52  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Voyager275**

Hey man. 

 I saw this didn't have any replies and I thought I would give you a little help. Sometimes people wont comment if the craft is very simple or at least, seems to be. What else have you made?

 Maybe hold a few craft back and release them all at once? Keep it up mate. And if you ever need help with anything most people here are happy to offer it 

MJ

> 
> Hey man. 
>  I saw this didn't have any replies and I thought I would give you a little help. Sometimes people wont comment if the craft is very simple or at least, seems to be. What else have you made?
> 
>  Maybe hold a few craft back and release them all at once? Keep it up mate. And if you ever need help with anything most people here are happy to offer it 
> 
> MJ

Thanks man. I will keep that in mind

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-26T23:24:42Z" title="08/26/2015 11:24  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 26, 2015</time> by Voyager275**
Recreate the launcher. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That'd tie the whole thing together. Cheers!

how these old sats generated eletricity?

or they just slowy died?

Yes of course! This.

> 
> Yes of course! This.

In my experience, the Lambda series and all of the mu besides the 5 are to be avoided. 0.625m rockets are painful to recreate, and I only went as far back as the Mu-3
